You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
- Reach your goal position from your starting position.
- To have as many chips as possible at the end of the game. 

Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.

Trading rules:

- In regular mode: You may trade resources with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 green for 1 blue, 1 green for 2 red, 2 green for nothing, etc.). 
- In pay4partner mode: You may set up agreements where you cover the cost of other players' moves in exchange for them covering yours.
{pay4partner_mode_info} 
- You may propose trades to other players, or accept trades proposed by others.
- You may chat with the opponent at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color). 
{pay4partner_scoring_info}
- REACHING YOUR GOAL IS MANDATORY - there is no partial credit for getting close.

Note: You have to reach your goal point, this is your ultimate goal. The secondary goal is to have as many chips as you can. You should not care about other players' performance.

1) my situation:
- i'm missing 2 blue chips to take the shortest path to my goal (3,3)
- i have excess red chips (14) but you need 0 reds
- i could take a longer path but that would cost more chips overall

2) your situation (based on your resources):

- you have excess blue chips (14) which i need
- you might be missing greens (you have only 1)

- the bottom-right goal tile (3,3) is green - will cost us 1 green at the end

proposal:
"since we both need to reach the same goal and have complementary resources, here's my offer:
if i reach my goal, i will give you 10 points.
if you reach your goal, you will give me 10 points."

this gives both of us an equal incentive to cooperate and share resources. i can provide you with red chips you likely need, and you can provide me with blue chips i need. what do you think?

- i have excess b chips which you need
- you have excess r chips which i need
- we both have exactly 1g which is just enough to start and finish

  - need each other's chip types equally
  - have equal ability to block the other if we don't cooperate
- combined we have perfect complementary resources (your rs for my bs)

"given our perfect resource complementarity, i accept your proposal with one small clarification:
if i reach my goal, i will give you exactly 10 points. 
if you reach your goal, you will give me exactly 10 points.
this creates perfect symmetry in our cooperation."

this ensures:
- neither of us is incentivized to defect later
- we both retain half the bonus (10+10=20)
- our remaining chips (after helping each other) will be worth equal amounts

agree
